page.title: 09A Farm Visit in Ladock
page.content: Mr Dustow owns Trobus Farm which is 120 acres.It was mentioned in the first Domesday Book as part of Trelowas Manor. His main income comes from dairy and he has got 50-60 Freisan cows.He grows grass and cuts silage for winter feed.He also has arable silage for his cattle.Mr Dustow has more than 40 beef bullocks which will be sold for beef and he has got one Hereford Bull.He has got about 59 sheep as well;50 ewes,2 rams and 7 lambs because he had sold the other lambs already.The sheep are either Devon and Cornwall Longwools which are kept for their wool or Half Breeds which are kept for their meat. Mr Dustow's son has got two ponies which he keeps for breeding and Mrs Dustow breeds terriors and raises turkeys.
